bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lou Chibbaro, Jr. officially joined the staff of the Blade as a full-time news reporter in 1984, but he had been writing for the Washington Blade as a freelance writer since 1977. He has covered many beats for the Blade including the federal agencies, elections, the Supreme Court, Congress and the White House. His reporting has focused on gay civil rights, and gay rights legislation. He has also written about crime and criminal trials involving anti-gay violence and hate crimes.

First published in 1969, The Washington Blade has grown becoming the weekly news source for Washington's large and visible Gay community. The Blade has been recognized by The Society of Professional Journalists, The American Bar Association, The Washington Post, The New York Times, The D.C. Metropolitan Police Department and others, as a highly professional news organization.
(Note adapted from MS2245, Washington Blade Lou Chibbaro senior reporter files)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by date of creation. Files containing reporter notepads and notebooks are grouped together by date.

The records are arranged by date of creation. While this is mostly chronological, there may be some overlap or dates out of order as processing followed the donor's inventory of boxes. An additional 16 boxes were donated in January 2022, after the initial processing was started. These boxes were added in at the end, starting with Box 198.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reporter's records and notes from Lou Chibarro, collecting work written during his employment by the Washington Blade. The records cover a wide range of subjects relating to the LGBTQ community in Washington D.C. and larger national issues regarding LGBTQ issues. These subjects include legal cases, political organization and activism, community organizations, hate crimes, local and national elections, arts and culture. The collection also contains information about Lous role at the Washington Blade, including notes on potential stories and editorial decisions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The contents of this series are aranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains cassette tapes, VCR tapes, film and floppy disks from Lou Chibaro. These recordings appear to be mostly recorded by Chibaro himself, including recordings of interviews he conducted, events he attended such as political meetings and campaign rallies, and forums and other speeches.
